intro: Dianthera incerta, commonly known as the uncertain dianthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest understories. Dianthera incerta is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique and striking floral display.
